Package com.olegtoropoff.petcareappointment.repository

Interface VeterinarianRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Veterinarian,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Veterinarian,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Veterinarian,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Veterinarian,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Veterinarian,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Veterinarian>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Veterinarian,Long>
public interface VeterinarianRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Veterinarian,Long>
Repository interface for managing Veterinarian entities. Provides methods for accessing veterinarian-related data from the database.

  • Method Details

    • findAllByUserTypeAndIsEnabled

      List<Veterinarian> findAllByUserTypeAndIsEnabled(String userType, boolean isEnabled)
      Retrieves a list of veterinarians filtered by user type and enabled status. This method fetches all records where the user type matches the specified value and the `enabled` field matches the given status.
      Parameters:
      userType - the type of user to filter by (e.g., "VET").
      isEnabled - the status indicating whether the user is enabled (true for enabled, false for disabled).
      Returns:
      a list of Veterinarian objects matching the specified criteria.

    • findBySpecializationAndIsEnabled

      List<Veterinarian> findBySpecializationAndIsEnabled(String specialization, boolean isEnabled)
      Finds all veterinarians by their specialization and enabled status.
      Parameters:
      specialization - the specialization of the veterinarian (e.g., "Dentistry", "Surgery").
      isEnabled - a flag indicating whether the veterinarian is active (`true`) or disabled (`false`).
      Returns:
      a List of veterinarians matching the specialization and enabled status.

    • existsBySpecialization

      boolean existsBySpecialization(String specialization)
      Checks if any veterinarians exist with the specified specialization.
      Parameters:
      specialization - the specialization to check.
      Returns:
      true if a veterinarian with the specialization exists, otherwise false.

    • getSpecializations

      @Query("SELECT DISTINCT v.specialization FROM Veterinarian v") List<String> getSpecializations()
      Retrieves a distinct list of all available veterinarian specializations.
      Returns:
      a list of strings representing the available specializations.

    • countVetsBySpecialization

      @Query("SELECT v.specialization AS specialization, COUNT(v) AS count FROM Veterinarian v GROUP BY v.specialization") List<Object[]> countVetsBySpecialization()
      Aggregates the number of veterinarians by their specialization.
      Returns:
      a list of objects, where each object contains the specialization and the corresponding count of veterinarians.

    • findVeterinarianWithPhotoById

      @Query("SELECT v FROM Veterinarian v LEFT JOIN FETCH v.photo WHERE v.id = :vetId") Optional<Veterinarian> findVeterinarianWithPhotoById(@Param("vetId") Long vetId)
      Retrieves a veterinarian by their ID along with their associated photo. Uses a **LEFT JOIN FETCH** to eagerly fetch the `photo` entity and avoid the **N+1 query problem**.
      Parameters:
      vetId - the ID of the veterinarian to retrieve.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the veterinarian with their photo if found, otherwise empty.
